body_html: @byronyi Using more memory can alleviate memory access conflicts, but can not totally eliminate it, since we don't know a priori what is the max parallelism. Once a conflict happens, some kind of retry is needed. We have been relying on tolerate_dup_recv for the re-tries.
body_text: @byronyi Using more memory can alleviate memory access conflicts, but can not totally eliminate it, since we don't know a priori what is the max parallelism. Once a conflict happens, some kind of retry is needed. We have been relying on tolerate_dup_recv for the re-tries.
body: @byronyi Using more memory can alleviate memory access conflicts, but can not totally eliminate it, since we don't know a priori what is the max parallelism. Once a conflict happens, some kind of retry is needed. We have been relying on tolerate_dup_recv for the re-tries.
